Field Label: Which one of the following is not a core element of feedback? (There may be more than one answer)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Be clear | 2, Be collaborative | 3, Focus on potential future improvements | 4, Help your colleague by trying to speculate on your colleague's intentions

Field Label: Which of the following are a core element of feedback? (There may be more than one answer)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Be clear | 2, Be collaborative/constructive/helpful | 3, Make general statements | 4, Focus on potential future improvements, instead of dwelling on past errors | 5, Do not be judgmental (e.g. 'you were lazy') | 6, Help by trying to speculate on intentions (e.g. 'you tried to avoid work') | 7, Instead of 'you' statements, use 'I' statements

Field Label: Which of the following should you not convey in your attitude when delivering feedback? (There may be more than one answer)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Your emotions | 2, Positive focus on improvement | 3, Neutrality with a focus on facts

Field Label: People generally rate themselves more harshly after a negative experience than a neutral observer rates them after the same experience.
